intro: Claoxylon longifolium var. rugifrux, commonly known as the rough-leafed claoxylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its rugged, serrated leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The bark and leaves of this plant have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
